bibl.title: The Papyri from Nahal Hever.
bibl.note: Presents a group of thirty-five papyri, mostly in Greek: these papyri are personal and family papers of a Jewish woman named Babatha, who lived in a village at the southern tip of the Dead Sea in the first third of the second century A.D.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II

bibl.seg: Lewis Naphtali, The Papyri from Nahal Hever.
Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II (Athens, 1988) pp. 127-132.

Presents a group of thirty-five papyri, mostly in Greek: these papyri are personal and family papers of a Jewish woman named Babatha, who lived in a village at the southern tip of the Dead Sea in the first third of the second century A.D.
